item.title: Report E-2024020420
item.description:
Report E-2024020420

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-10
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 10, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1760 was damaged due to unknown causes and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the trailer floor, lift gate, wood, and asphalt ground. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration, LLC (ER) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and worked them in with hand tools. A hose was utilized to perform a gravity transfer to remove the remaining product from the damaged tote into a new tote provided by ER. The new tote was properly labeled and left on-site for disposal. Crews dismantled the damaged tote and impacted wooden pallet with hand tools for disposal purposes. All spent absorbents, impacted pallet, and tote were collected and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024020424
item.description:
Report E-2024020424

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 12, 2024, twenty-four (24) 12-ounce cans of aerosol paint (UN1263) were punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the cardboard box and trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized absorbent pads to collect all freestanding product, and any residual material was removed with a degreasing agent. All spent absorbent pads and impacted cardboard were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and the damaged cans were collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. The drums were properly labeled and possession of the material was taken by R+L for disposal through their bulk waste stream.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered damaged at NEWO 0701 on 2/5, but the person who performed the DPR elected to return it immediately without an ISF or HESS entry/disposition. Package was discovered 2/8 at MPGR 0553in a trailer during unload in its original packaging, wet and leaking more. HESS specialist placed it in a lined tote, brought it to the damage area, and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. DescribePack: two bottles leaked due to loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

  • Description: 1. X-2024021019 SequenceEvent: Package was found with the bottom of the box wet while loading. Upon inspection There are 4 1-gallon bottles inside of the box in a plastic bag, 3 of which looked like they had leaked from the cap. At some point during transit, the package could have been put on its side or upside down, not following the direction of the orientation arrows. No other cracks or holes were found that would result in contents leaking. Package was put in a red hazmat tote and taken to a designated QA area for processing. DescribePack: All bottles still had the caps on them but still resulted in them leaking. No other defects were found. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in a red hazmat tote and taken to a designated QA area for processing. 2. X-2024021026 SequenceEvent: Package was found with the bottom of the box wet while loading. Upon inspection there are 4 1-gallon bottles inside of the box in a plastic bag, 1 of which was leaking from the cap when put upside down or on its side. Package at some point during transit was most likely put on its side resulting in contents leaking. Package was put in a red hazmat tote and taken to a designated QA area for processing. DescribePack: One bottle had a loose cap resulting in it leaking contents when put on its side or upside down. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in a red hazmat tote and taken to a designated QA area for processing.

  • Description: On February 8, 2024, three (3) 5-gallon containers of isopropanol arrived damaged due to unknown causes and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the isopropanol-impacted trailer and concrete. TLE crews collected and containerized all impacted material into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged them on site for transport and disposal.

  • Description: Material was shipped as a non-regulated shipment of petroleum distillates. Once received the material was analyzed by our lab and the flash point of the material was determined to be 138F. The material was determined to be a hazardous waste UN 1268 Petroleum Distillates with a waste code of D001 for ignitibility. The material did ship on a hazardous waste manifest (MT# 0206124145JJK). To rectify the situation, we updated the shipping description and waste codes on the hazardous waste manifest. We relabeled the drums with hazardous waste labels and are managing the waste as hazardous.

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: KEARNY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 9, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of NA1993 was punctured in transit due to no dunnage and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel secured the damaged tote and proceeded to transfer the NA1993 to one (1) new 330-gallon poly tote that was fitted with the appropriate labels for further shipment and processing. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the released product in the trailer and swept them in with hand tools. The one (1) empty and damaged tote was cut up with hand tools. Two (2) 55-gallon poly drums of spent absorbents, PPE, the cut-up tote, and any cleanup debris were generated as waste and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Description: On February 8, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. Cleaners and absorbent pads were utilized to remove any residual product. The damaged pail, all UN1263 impacted materials, and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal

  • Description: 1. X-2024021025 SequenceEvent: Package was located inside the trailer and smoke was coming from it I was called to retrieve the package and inspected, package was wet and when inspected it was found that the bottle was leaking from the bottom. DescribePack: bottle was cracked at the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE was brought to contain the package in a hazmat bag and a tote after I cleaned the area and took another package that was leaked on or damage. 2. X-2024021114 SequenceEvent: Three of twenty identical HazMat packages were reported leaking when being unloaded at station. Of the seventeen that were assessed and determined to be unaffected and sent OFD, two more developed leaks in transit, affecting in all ten packages. These packages were transferred from the van they were on to be brought back to station for processing, along with the other seven, refused by recipient due to exposure to the leakage incident. DescribePack: Internal bottle cracked at edge of base. Crack was visually about a half inch in length, though it was only leaking from a section of the crack. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Affected packages were removed from original van and returned to station. Unknown what other packages were aboard van that continued on its route. 3. X-2024021226 SequenceEvent: Package was inside the trailer wet and was called for an inspection and was found that one of the bottles was leaking from the bottom as it was cracked. DescribePack: Small crack at the bottom of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a hazmat bag and a tote and then taken into the hazmat area as well as the area where the leak happened was cleaned up.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at Hazmat location with signs of external damages. The package was inspected, and signs of internal leakage was found. Two of the contents leaked out. One was found without a cap and the other with a very loose cap. The remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The package failure came about due to a missing cap from one bottle and a loose cap from another. One of the bottles leaked out in its entirety and the other bottle leaked out approximately 1/16 of its content. No holes or punctures were found on either of the bottles that leaked. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: All contents were immediately inspected, caps were replaced and tightened and placed in a lined salvage drum to prevent any further leakage or damages.

  • City: CEDAR RAPIDS

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCR experienced a UN2693 Sodium Bisulfite 40% release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10 ounces of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a crack on the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The released product was neutralized with baking soda and collected with absorbent pads. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into an 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced a UN1805 Low pH Presoak release from a 15-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released to a 3’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor/pallet due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents and soda ash solution were deployed and worked into the impacted area to clean and neutralize the release. The impacted absorbents and pallet wood were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum of the product was patched with chem tape and placed into a separate 55- gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On February 9, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was damaged by a forklift and released approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected the absorbents used by the terminal staff and deployed more as needed to the dock, trailer, and pavement surfaces. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon salvage drum for disposal. All impacted absorbents and solid waste was collected and contianerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. FCE remediated staining on the dock floor and pavement to the extent practicable with paint thinner and acetone. Both waste drums were labeled and staged onsite.

  • Description: On February 9, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of corrosive liquid was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the corrosive liquid-impacted roadway and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BEING UNLOADED AND APPARENTLY PLACED ON THE BELT AND THERE WAS VISIBLE DAMAGE. PKG WAS QUICKLY SECURED IN A YELLOW HAZMAT DRUM AND SEALED DUE TO THE STRONG ODOR OF THE CONTENTS. PKG WAS LATER INVESTIGATED AT THE QA DAMAGE TABLE AFTER THE SORT. DescribePack: MISHANDLING AND TOO MUCH REHANDLE WAS THE CAUSE. PKG HAS BEEN RECYCLING FOR 2 WEEKS BACK AND FORTH FROM THE SHIPPER DUE TO IMPORPER PAPERWORK. BOTTLE INSIDE WAS GLASS SO IT WAS EITHER DROPPED OR THROWN ONTO THE BELT, CAUSING IT TO BREAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ENTIRE PKG WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT DRUM AND SEALED AND SECURED AWAY FROM STATION EMPLOYEE.

item.title: Report E-2024020357
item.description:
Report E-2024020357

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: LITTLE AMERICA
  • State: WY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: US Xpress, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 10-15 gallons of battery acid released due to battery housing fault. The release impacted a 6’ X 2’ area on the asphalt underneath the trailer and trailer floor. No storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. EnviroServe arrived on-site and neutralized the acid with a caustic material then deployed absorbents to solidify the release. The contractor collected and containerized the impacted batteries into 3-95-gallon poly drums and all clean-up debris into 1-55-gallon poly drums. The damaged batteries that were overpacked into 3–95-gallon poly DFs were secured inside the trailer for transit. EnviroServe departed the site with the 1–55-gallon poly drum and staged the waste at their office pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024020371
item.description:
Report E-2024020371

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-21
  • City: Centerville
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COFFEYVILLE RESOUCES CRUDE TRANSPORTATION, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Transport was headed West on CR1077, when the vehicle failed to negotiate the curve that curved back South. Driver stated he looked away from the roadway to check on an empty water bottle, when his steer tire went over the shoulder. The driver decided not to correct the transport, striking trees and caution chevrons, overturning the transport and splitting the trailer in half on impact. The trailer released the entire load 154 barrels. Safety was immediately dispatched from Coffeyville Resources to start clean up and remediation. The Kansas Highway Patrol was dispatched at the time of the incident, the road was diverted while the transport and trailer was towed. Clean up began on 01/21 but was delayed due to weather conditions (rain and ice). The soil has been dug up and transported to a landfill. The Coffeyville Resources Pipeline group hauled Vac trucks of the water used to keep the soil from continuing to be contaminated to the Coffeyville Refinery. The clean up was completed on 2/16.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg loaded to delivery truck and out for dlvry. Driver noticed wet outer pack, coded 10 inspection required. Pkg sent to QA department. During inspection noted hazmat label and used proper protective equipment. Outer pack cardboard slightly dented on top, wet at bottom and small area on side. Inner product dented in on top of one side causing plastic to crack at seam of jug, both jugs dented in. One much worse with small 2 cm hole, leaking contents onto outer pack. Miss handling was not noted by staff, unsure what happened to cause dented top of product. DescribePack: Inner product dented in on top of one side causing plastic to crack at seam of jug along vertical edge, both jugs dented in. One much worse with small 2 cm hole, leaking contents onto outer pack. Miss handling was not noted by staff, unsure what happened to cause dented top of product. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Driver isolated product during transport. Station staff used PPE and contained package in Hazmat tote. moved to Hazmat area for inspection.

  • City: GEORGETOWN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA from unload in a tote with contents leaking from the outside. I realized it was a damage Hazmat and took it to the Hazmat Cage to start processing. DescribePack: Box was ripped from the opening, down the side to the bottom. Hydrogen Peroxide and Peroxyacetic Acid mixture stabilized, 5.1 (8), 11, 3.781, Oxidizer Corrosive inside of a plastic bag that was leaking contents. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed in a hazardous materials bag inside a yellow drum. I used the chemical neutralizer on the visible spilled liquid. This is a Class 8 liquid, so I confirmed neutralization using the PH test. Levels were between 6-9, at 8. Once there was no heat and had cooled down, I placed the fiberboard box in the drum and secured the bag with a zip tie. Drum is sealed and waiting to be picked up by authorized personnel.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE. PACKAGE DEEMED PUNCTURED, CAUSING AN INTERNAL LEAKAGE OF INTERNAL CONTENTS. 1 OF 6 CARTRIDGES FAILED, BUT ENTIRE PACKAGES STAINED AND SOILED. CONTENTS DEEMED AS PRINTING INK UN1210. 6 CARTRIDGES X 4.5 LITERS TOTAL. DescribePack: FAILED AT BODY OF CARTRIDGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY MANNER. APPROXIMATELY 1/2 CUP LEAKED FROM ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES DUE TO IT HAVING A LOOSE CAP. DescribePack: ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES INSIDE THE PACKAGE HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING APPROXIMATELY 1/2 CUP OF LIQUID TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE THEN IMMEDIATELY CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK THE PRODUCTS INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM. X-2024020785-SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND RIPPED. MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK THE PRODUCTS INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY MANNER. APPROXIMATELY 3 LITERS LEAKED OUT FROM PART B DUE TO IT HAVING A LOOSE CAP. AWAITING THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: ONE OF FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING APPROXIMATELY 3 LITERS TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING PACKAGE OVER THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY AND THEN IMMEDIATELY CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY MANNER.

item.title: Report I-2024020014
item.description:
Report I-2024020014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T00:33:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-27
  • City: DFW
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: QATAR AIRWAYS CARGO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A package was tendered by forwarder DHL to Qatar Airways in DFW under MAWB 157-89110081 declared as consolidation. Actual contents were medical equipment and accessories per HAWB description which contained lithium ion batteries. It was not booked as an ELI shipment as it was supposed to but had an ELI label and PSN written on package. Upon acceptance and build up GHA where house staff failed to notice the ELI label and the PSN. As a result it was manifested and forwarded as general cargo on flight QR730/24Jan DFWDOH. Upon arrival of flight in Doha, it was discovered as a undeclared battery shipment. Shipment was held in Doha until proper documents were furnished to match package contents and labeling. Report filed with local CAA.

  • Description: Landstar contracted ERTSr to request help with a spill inside of a trailer at First Source Worldwide, located at 413 Virgil Dr. in Dalton, GA. The spill consists of approximately 3 cups of UN1797 Ammonium bifluoride, solid (trade name unknown), which released from a torn 55 pound paper bag. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors were informed that 3 cups of AMMONIUM HYDROGEN DIFLUORIDE SOLID (UN1727, 8, II) was released from (1) 55-pound bag. Facility personnel cleaned the release and will manage all waste generated.

  • Description: At 10:49 ET, personnel with Circle K contacted ERTS to request assistance with cleaning a diesel spill that was released at Circle K #2700428 located at 1953 AZ-260, Heber-Overgaard, AZ 85928, USA. The caller stated that during a gas delivery the driver overfilled and impacted asphalt and concrete. At the request of the caller, ERTS will dispatch a contractor to complete the cleanup. Graymar observed a 40-gallon release of diesel fuel to a 30' by 30' area of pavement that had absorbents applied prior to arrival. Two bags of absorbents were used to contain the liquid, impacted absorbents were containerized into (1) 55-gallon metal drum and is being removed from the site to be staged at Graymar's facility until disposal can be coordinated with ERTS.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver connected drop gun to the ground connection per drivers statement. Driver connected hose to drop gun and tried to remove cap from other end but had issues. Driver removed hose from other end at drop gun to twist hose to loosen cap. Caps comes loose and the driver connects to trailer connection. Driver open external then internal and he turned around and about 20 gals of diesel was coming out of the hose. Driver failed to reconnect hose to drop gun fitting and didn't trace his hoses out to make sure they were connected before opening his valves.

item.title: Report E-2024020342
item.description:
Report E-2024020342

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: PLYMOUTH
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1042 ET, Schneider Bulk contacted ERTS to report a hazardous cargo release. It was reported 50-100 gallons of UN 1814 "Conquest" released due to tank overflow while the driver was performing a delivery at Zentis Food 2050 North Oak Dr, Plymouth, IN. It was reported no drains, soil or waterways were impacted. RMS arrived on site and advised 100ft by 30ft area on concrete inside the facility was impacted and migrated outside the building onto a 15ft by 20ft area of concrete. No drains or waterways were impacted. RMS utilized a pump to collect as much free standing liquid as possible, then utilize a neutralizing absorbent to clean the remaining areas. At 1505 ET, RMS advised they utilizied Chemsorb CA to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. ERTS reached out to RMS for an update. The contractor advised they have begun applying a 30% white vinegar solution to the impacted areas of the spill as the Chemsorb was not proving effective. The vinegar solution has been getting much better results and they have noted no hazardous reactions. The team sprayed the solution and then used spill pads to remove the liquid/residue. All waste was staged on site at the facility until profiled and properly disposed.

  • Carrier/Reporter: FUEL SOUTH EXPRESS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 20 gallons of diesel were released due to mechanical failure while offloading. The release impacted asphalt and concrete in a 34' x 43' and 20' x 4' area. No storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. Absorbents were applied to the spill. Hepaco generated 2-55 gallon poly waste drums containing the absorbents used to clean the release and transported the waste off-site to their facility.
